meanings.definition: Having or showing an intense and selfish desire for more wealth, power, food, etc.
meanings.sent1: The greedy squirrel became even greedier when it found a whole stash of acorns.
meanings.sent2: She was greedier than her siblings, always wanting the biggest slice of cake.
meanings.sent3: The greedy cat became even greedier when it discovered a second bowl of tuna.
meanings.sent4: His greedier attitude towards money made him lose friends along the way.
meanings.sent5: The greedy child's eyes grew even greedier when presented with a mountain of candy.

meanings.definition: Wanting more than one needs or deserves.
meanings.sent1: The greedier puppy tried to snatch both bones at once.
meanings.sent2: She felt greedier than ever, taking more cookies than she could eat.
meanings.sent3: The greedier student tried to grab extra pencils from the teacher's desk.
meanings.sent4: His greedier behavior at the buffet led to a stomachache later.
meanings.sent5: The greedier shopper filled her cart with items she didn't really need.
